3a71e74b-1a3a-4957-8e86-8622ed84988d.description: The course objective is to provide entry-level knowledge and skills to members of the U.S. Armed Forces needed to fulfill the duties of a multidisciplinary assignment in public affairs, visual information, and communication in support of the commander's intent. This course is recommended for a total of 18 semester hours: 9 semester hours at the lower-division baccalaureate/associate degree category and 9 semester hours at the upper division baccalaureate degree category.
3a71e74b-1a3a-4957-8e86-8622ed84988d.name: Mass Communication Foundations (DINFOS-MCF) (v.1)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, examinations, presentations, written papers, and performance rubrics (checklists) with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include audiovisual materials, practical exercises, learner presentations, lecture, discussion, classroom exercises, and computer-based training.

600fe9cd-3497-444b-a03d-570d574a8101.description: The course objective is to provide entry-level public affairs training for mid- to senior-level non-commissioned officers (NCOs) and commissioned officers from all U.S. Armed Forces and select foreign nations, as well as U.S. government agency civilians selected for public affairs. This course will ensure those NCOs, officers and civilians are capable of performing the basic duties of Department of Defense (DoD) military public affairs practitioners.
600fe9cd-3497-444b-a03d-570d574a8101.name: Public Affairs and Communications Strategy Qualification Course (DINFOS-PACS-Q) (v.3)
